alert.note: Alert for Dickens; Kent; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:04PM CDT until June 02 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR EASTERN KENT...EASTERN DICKENS...KING...SOUTHEASTERN MOTLEY... SOUTHWESTERN COTTLE AND STONEWALL COUNTIES... At 704 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Paducah to 8 miles north of Swenson to 11 miles north of Rotan, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Aspermont, Jayton, Guthrie, Grow, Peacock, Dumont, Finney, Delwin, Chalk and Swenson. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
